intro: Callianthe muelleri-friderici, commonly known as the Mueller's callianthe, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, elongated leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in well-drained conditions. It is often found in coastal and inland regions, particularly in the southwestern parts of Western Australia. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
